actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > strategy.py
import random
def row_strategy(history):
    if len(history) < 2:
        # Early game: random choice to avoid predictability
        return random.randint(0, 1)
    
    # Track last few moves to detect patterns
    last_moves = [move for _, move in history[-5:]]
    
    # Opponent copies our last move 80% of the time
    # So if they copied our move, we should expect them to continue
    # But we want to exploit their tendency to copy by alternating
    # to force them into a predictable pattern
    
    # If opponent has mirrored our move recently, we should deviate
    # to break their copying pattern
    if len(last_moves) >= 2:
        # If opponent mirrored our last move (i.e., their move == our last move)
        # and they did so in the last 3 rounds, we deviate
        recent_mirror_count = sum(1 for i in range(1, len(last_moves)) 
                                 if last_moves[i] == history[-(i+1)][0])
        if recent_mirror_count >= 2:
            # They are copying us — break the pattern by switching
            return 1 - history[-1][0]
    
    # Otherwise, follow a simple alternating pattern to induce uncertainty
    # This disrupts their copying behavior over time
    if len(history) % 3 == 0:
        return 1
    else:
        return history[-1][0]
ENDOFFILE
